intro: Camissonia confusa, commonly known as the slender camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are white or pale purple. Camissonia confusa is often found in coastal and inland grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
